param.label: JEZ Module Includer Joomla! 1.5 plugin v1.0.0

params.param:
JEZ Module Includer Joomla! 1.5 plugin, or JEZ Module Includer for short, is a system plugin developed to support loading any individual module anywhere you like from within an article, within a custom HTML module to within the output of any Joomla! extension.

JEZ Module Includer is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Share Alike 3.0 Unported license.

Please visit JoomlaEZ.com for getting started guide, documentation and get support on using / implementing JEZ Module Includer.

Default module chrome to wrap around rendered module output. Choose 1 from following module chromes:

  • raw

    Raw output.

  • xhtml

    Joomla!'s xhtml module chrome.

  • rounded

    Joomla!'s rounded module chrome.

  • jezRounded6ImgsNested

    JEZ Skeleton's jezRounded6ImgsNested module chrome. This module chrome creates rounded corners the similar way as Joomla!'s rounded module chrome but use 6 images and 6 nested divs instead of 4.

  • jezRounded6Imgs

    JEZ Skeleton's jezRounded6Imgs module chrome. This module chrome creates rounded corners using schillmania.com's More Rounded Corners With CSS technique.

  • jezRounded1Img

    JEZ Skeleton's jezRounded1Img module chrome. This module chrome creates rounded corners using schillmania.com's Even More Rounded Corners With CSS technique.

  • jezRounded1ImgScroll

    JEZ Skeleton's jezRounded1ImgScroll module chrome. This module chrome uses same technique as jezRounded1Img but scrollable if content is overflown.

• If Use Inclusion Syntax option is enabled, all you need to do is insert the string {loadmodule module_id module_chrome module_class_suffix} where you want the module specified by module_id displays. Using inclusion syntax allows loading of any individual module anywhere you want from within an article, within a custom HTML module to the output of any Joomla! extension.
  • If Use Inclusion Syntax option is disabled, you need to manually insert the following PHP code to where you want to load a specific module in the view file of individual Joomla! extension: 
    global $mainframe;
$module = array(
	module_id,
	module_chrome,
	module_class_suffix
);
$mainframe->triggerEvent('onLoadModule', $module);

The module output will be wrapped by the module chrome specified by module_chrome and applied the suffix module_class_suffix. If module_chrome and module_class_suffix are not specified in inclusion syntax or parameters array passed to triggerEvent function, the default values specified above will be used.
